Tabs

Use tab navigation to break related information into smaller chuncks of content. When working with tabs, some content is hidden. Therefore it's important to label the tabs wisely, allowing the user to know exactly what to expect in a tab. On mobile, tab navigation is transformed into a dropdown menu.

Installation 

                  
                    npm i @govflanders/vl-ui-tabs

or 

                  
                    yarn add @govflanders/vl-ui-tabs

Usage

Import SASS 

                  
                  @import "vl-ui-tabs/src/scss/tabs";

Make sure your sass --include-path includes node_modules/@govflanders/.

Import JS

                  
                  import { Tabs } from '@govflanders/vl-ui-tabs';

Modifiers

Tabs

  • [data-vl-tab]*: apply [data-vl-tab] together with a unique ID to all the .vl-tab__link elements.
  • [data-vl-tab-pane]*: apply [data-vl-tab-pane] to all .vl-tab_pane elements. This will ensure, together with the [vl-data-tab] and [vl-data-tabs-list] elements that all JavaScript functionality is added to the corresponding elements.
  • [data-vl-tabs-list]*: add [data-vl-tabs-list] to the .vl-tabs element. This will ensure, together with the [vl-data-tab] and [vl-data-tab-pane] elements that all JavaScript functionality is added to the corresponding elements.
  • [data-vl-tabs-responsive-label="Navigatie"]: add this attribute to the elements that have the [data-vl-tabs] attribute. A label is shown when no option is selected in the dropdown menu (on mobile). The label is "Navigation" by default.
  • Trein
  • Metro, tram en bus
  • Fiets

    <div class="vl-tabs__wrapper">
      <ul class="vl-tabs " data-vl-tabs-list role="tablist"><li class="vl-tab">
            <a class="vl-tab__link" id="vl-tab-nummer-1" href="#vl-tab-nummer-1" data-vl-tab role="tab" aria-controls="vl-tab-nummer-1-pane">Trein</a>
          </li><li class="vl-tab">
            <a class="vl-tab__link" id="vl-tab-nummer-2" href="#vl-tab-nummer-2" data-vl-tab role="tab" aria-controls="vl-tab-nummer-2-pane">Metro, tram en bus</a>

          </li>
      </ul>

Tabs (alt)

Apply the .vl-tabs--alt class modifier to display the variant of the tabs component. The alt variant serves as a subnavigation under the functional header. Only use this as subnavigation at the top of the page. Apply .vl-u-no-overflow on the wrapping .vl-region container element when using the .vl-tabs--alt modifier class. This prevents an overflow and thus a horizontal scroll. When using the .vl-tabs--alt modifier class, also apply the .vl-region--no-space-top to .vl-region element. This removes the top margin between the header and the tabs component.

  • Metro, tram en bus
  • Fiets

Usability

Tips on using tabs:

  • Use clear, concise and descriptive labels to help the user to navigate between tabs. Limit the label to maximum 2 words. Short labels are easier to read.
  • Don't use capitals only, it makes labels harder to read.
  • Limit the number of tabs to a single row and always place the tabs above the tab content.
